<H4>Language  Support</H4><hr>
<p>OPD is developed with the idea of it being easy to translate to another language, so that it can meet the needs of users. Localization or adaptation to a language is structured in 3 parts:</p>
<ul>
    <li>Core and Clients (Web and Swing)</li>
    <li>User Documentation</li>
    <li>Administration Documentation</li>
</ul>
<p>In this version, the localization covers:</p>
<table style="border-width:thin;border-color: grey;border:solid;border-spacing:4pt">
    <thead style="background:lightgray;">
        <tr><td  style="text-align:center;">Language</td><td>Core and Clients</td> <td>User Doc.</td><td>Administration Doc.</td>
        </tr>  
    </thead>
    <tr>
        <td>  http://dl.dropbox.com/u/49603479/OpenProdoc/ES/Img/F_Spain.png  Spanish</td><td style="text-align:center;">Yes</td> <td style="text-align:center;">Yes</td> <td style="text-align:center;">Yes</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
        <td>  http://dl.dropbox.com/u/49603479/OpenProdoc/ES/Img/F_UK.png  English</td><td style="text-align:center;">Yes</td> <td style="text-align:center;">Yes</td> <td style="text-align:center;">Yes</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
        <td>  http://dl.dropbox.com/u/49603479/OpenProdoc/ES/Img/F_Portugal.png  Portuguese</td><td style="text-align:center;">Yes</td> <td style="text-align:center;">No</td> <td style="text-align:center;">No</td>
    </tr>
</table>
<p>Regarding location should be noted that the date format is covered with customization ( [EN_ListCustom Customizacion]), so that support for countries sharing a language, but a different format date is just translation.</p>
